market_context.note: Brazilian company with ADR listing on NASDAQ; reports in BRL per IFRS

nodes.label: Strategic Pivot to SaaS
nodes.description: January 2025 announcement of new strategic cycle focusing on Zenvia Customer Cloud (SaaS) as core business, evaluating CPaaS divestiture to deleverage balance sheet
nodes.note: Execution risk on product-market fit, franchisee ramp, and CPaaS divestiture timeline/valuation

nodes.label: Revenue Mix Shift to CPaaS
nodes.description: CPaaS revenue increased from 66% to 72% of total revenue Q2 2024→Q2 2025, while SaaS declined from 34% to 28%. Driven by WhatsApp/SMS volume growth but at much lower margins
nodes.note: Contradicts strategic intent to focus on SaaS; reflects short-term market dynamics and competitive pressure

nodes.label: Gross Margin Compression
nodes.description: Consolidated gross margin collapsed from 38% (H1 2024) to 20% (H1 2025). CPaaS margin declined from 24% to 12% due to carrier cost increases and competitive pricing. SaaS margin improved slightly from 54.5% to 55.4%
nodes.note: Severe margin pressure driven by CPaaS commoditization and unfavorable revenue mix

nodes.label: Operational Efficiency Gains
nodes.description: G&A expenses reduced 25% YoY (H1 2025 vs H1 2024) through 15% workforce reduction. G&A as % of revenue improved from 14.5% to 8.3% (7% ex-severance)
nodes.note: Successful cost discipline; BRL 30-35MM annual savings expected from workforce reduction

nodes.label: Negative Working Capital & Liquidity Stress
nodes.description: Negative working capital of BRL 444MM (current assets BRL 271MM vs current liabilities BRL 715MM). Cash declined from BRL 117MM (Dec 2024) to BRL 33MM (June 2025). Net debt BRL 60MM plus BRL 271MM acquisition liabilities
nodes.note: Going concern risk acknowledged in footnotes; dependent on debt renegotiations, asset sales, and working capital optimization

nodes.label: Debt Renegotiation & Covenant Waivers
nodes.description: Feb 2024 renegotiation extended bank debt from 18 to 36 months, M&A liabilities from 36 to 60 months, with option to convert BRL 100MM to equity. Q2 2025 obtained waivers for Net Debt/EBITDA covenant breaches
nodes.note: Provides runway but signals financial fragility; future covenant compliance uncertain

nodes.label: Zenvia Customer Cloud Traction
nodes.description: Zenvia Customer Cloud (unified CX platform) showed 80% usage increase Q2 vs Q1 2025, 23% YoY revenue growth. Franchisee channel launched Q1 2025, now 34 franchisees contributing 15% of new MRR in Brazil
nodes.note: Early signs of product-market fit but still small relative to total revenue; franchisee model unproven at scale

nodes.label: CPaaS Commoditization & Competitive Pressure
nodes.description: CPaaS market experiencing severe pricing pressure (similar to 2H 2022). Carrier cost increases passed through with lag. Management expects margins to normalize to ~20% by Q4 2025 but business fundamentally low-margin
nodes.note: Industry-wide commoditization; ZENV's scale advantages eroding as competition intensifies

nodes.label: Geographic Concentration Risk
nodes.description: Brazil represents 82% of H1 2025 revenue, USA 14%, Argentina operates in hyperinflationary environment (IAS 29 impact BRL 1.5MM H1 2025)
nodes.note: High exposure to Brazilian macroeconomic and regulatory risk; Argentina subsidiary marginal but adds complexity

nodes.label: Management & Governance Churn
nodes.description: CFO change Sept 2025 (Shay Chor → Piero Rosatelli, former Oria Capital partner/board member). Dec 2025 CHRO and CTO departures with roles absorbed by CFO and CRO. CPaaS spun off as independent BU Dec 1, 2025
nodes.note: Streamlining or instability? New CFO has investor background; cost focus but execution risk elevated

nodes.label: EBITDA Resilience Despite Volatility
nodes.description: LTM normalized EBITDA stable at BRL 88-100MM despite gross margin compression, enabled by aggressive G&A reduction. Demonstrates operational leverage if top-line growth resumes
nodes.note: BRL 100MM run-rate sustainable with current cost structure; upside if SaaS scales

nodes.label: CPaaS Divestiture Optionality
nodes.description: Management exploring CPaaS sale to deleverage balance sheet. Historical CPaaS transactions at ~1.0x revenue globally. CPaaS revenue ~BRL 420MM H1 annualized suggests BRL 400-500MM potential proceeds
nodes.note: Timing and valuation highly uncertain; market conditions for CPaaS M&A deteriorating

nodes.label: Controlling Shareholder Support
nodes.description: Bobsin Corp (founder Cassio Bobsin) and Oria funds collectively control majority voting power. Feb 2024 BRL 50MM equity injection. Convertible M&A liabilities provide additional dilution buffer
nodes.note: Alignment strong but dilution risk for minority shareholders if M&A liabilities convert to equity

nodes.label: AI/Automation Positioning
nodes.description: Zenvia Customer Cloud positioned as "AI CX SaaS provider" integrating marketing, sales, service, and engagement. Management emphasizes AI-driven automation and cost reduction for customers
nodes.note: Competitive AI landscape; differentiation unclear vs global players (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.)

causal_relationships.mechanism: Strategic focus and resource allocation toward Zenvia Customer Cloud enables product development, go-to-market expansion (franchisees), and customer adoption
Shift to higher CPaaS mix (72% vs 28% SaaS) mechanically reduces consolidated gross margin because CPaaS operates at 12% margin vs SaaS 55% margin
CPaaS competitive pressure and pricing dynamics drive volume growth but at deteriorating unit economics, increasing CPaaS revenue share
CPaaS commoditization and carrier cost increases directly compress CPaaS gross margin from 24% to 12%, dragging down consolidated margin
Negative working capital and liquidity stress forced debt renegotiations and covenant waiver requests to avoid default
Gross margin compression reduces operating cash flow generation, exacerbating liquidity stress and negative working capital
G&A reduction (25% YoY) partially offsets gross margin compression, enabling EBITDA to remain resilient at BRL 88-100MM LTM
Liquidity stress and negative working capital create urgency for CPaaS divestiture to deleverage balance sheet and raise cash
Strategic pivot to SaaS-only business model makes CPaaS divestiture strategically coherent and potentially value-accretive if proceeds used to fund SaaS growth
Successful CPaaS sale at ~BRL 400-500MM could eliminate net debt and acquisition liabilities, resolving liquidity stress
Zenvia Customer Cloud adoption and revenue growth (23% YoY, targeting BRL 200MM FY25) at 70% gross margin would materially improve EBITDA if it becomes larger revenue share
CFO change to former investor (Oria partner) and executive departures signal urgency to execute strategic pivot and improve capital efficiency
Controlling shareholder support (Bobsin/Oria) facilitated Feb 2024 equity injection and option to convert BRL 100MM M&A liabilities to equity, reducing refinancing risk
Geographic concentration in Brazil (82% revenue) exposes company to Brazilian macroeconomic shocks, currency volatility, and regulatory risk, which can exacerbate liquidity stress
AI/automation positioning differentiates Zenvia Customer Cloud in Latin American market and drives customer adoption (80% usage growth Q2 vs Q1)
